Items.Name: MARVEL COMIC RADIO AD SCRIPT:CAPTAIN AMERICA
Items.Description: INTERNATIONAL BIDDERS WELCOME! BID NOW:THIS AUCTION CAN END AT ANY TIME! Hello, Marvel Comics superheroes! This auction is for a comic book store RADIO SCRIPTS booklet. The cover features Avengers leader CAPTAIN AMERICA (with art by DC artist Kevin Maguire). With this radio station ad script kit, Marvel encouraged retailers to create their own co-op advertisements for on-the-air radio broadcasting spots, and these scripts were designed as a fun way for comic books stores to perform and record their radio ads "the Marvel Way". The scripts in this booklet promoted titles such as the Amazing Spider-man, Capt America, the Silver Surfer, Daredevil, the Avengers, Ghost Rider, Conan the Barbarian, the Uncanny X-Men, the Incredible Hulk, the Fantastic Four, etc. This extremely RARE Marvel artifact came out in 1992, and was sent absolutely, strictly, to comic book retail shops to boost sales of trade paperback & graphic novel releases, comic books, etc. This item is in UNUSED NEAR MINT condition. Remember to check out OTHER similar Marvel promos such as this in my other auctions! PLEASE READ TERMS BEFORE BIDDING: Win more than 1 spectacular auction & SAVE ON SHIPPING when items are paid for together. I ship QUICKLY and your items will be packed VERY WELL! (Check my feedback!) USA winners pay $3.50 for postage/handling/insurance. NEW YORK STATE RESIDENTS: Please add the appropriate NYS sales tax for your County for the total amount (high bid plus postage/handling/insurance amount). Canadian winners pay $3.50 for postage/handling/insurance & pay by Paypal, Bidpay, Billpoint, Citybank C2it, or international POSTAL money orders only, payable in US dollars. No checks accepted, unfortunately. All other countries pay $7.50 shipping & handling for airmail shipping. Payment can be made by Paypal, Bidpay, Billpoint, Citybank C2it, or international POSTAL money orders only, payable in US dollars. Sorry, but no checks accepted. Payment to be received within 10 days of auction's end. Thanks very much Super-heroes, and remember to aim your web shooter at my OTHER AUCTIONS! Items.Name: HARMONY KINGDOM ~ ARIA AMOROSA ~ RETIRED
Items.Description: HARMONY KINGDOM ~ ARIA AMOROSA ~ RETIRED Name: Aria Amorosa Artist: Peter Calvesbert Item No: TJES Collection Name: Treasure Jest Subset Name: Small Treasure Jest Exclusive To: Made In: England Status: Retired Carving Date: 1997 Release Date: 1/1/1998 In Store Date: Retirement Date: 7/1/1998 Edition Size: 9530 US Issue Price in USD: $45 UK Issue Price in GBP: 29.5 CAN Issue Price in CND: $70 Category: Box Figurine Dimensions (Inches): 1.93 x 2.83 x 2.95 S e c r e t s This box figurine depicts two seals, lovingly entwined, mouths open in song. A plimsol line with numerical markings runs down the belly of one of them, a representation of the amount of oil that can be extracted from an elephant seal. Peter carved the cigarette lighter under the other seal s flipper after a beach-combing trip in North Wales where he found the beach littered with plastic lighters. Peter s mouse looks out startled from under another flipper. The inspiration for the rat carved inside was a topical news item that Peter misheard on the radio at the time of carving: the monster rat catastrophe. It turns out that it was the Montserrat catastrophe, a volcano threatening to erupt in the Caribbean. Hallmarks include , heart, HBC logo, ed.#, and Pc, with "P. Calvesbert" on the base. 1ST EDITION, NEVER DISPLAYED. THIS BOX WAS FROM THE FIRST RELEASE AND THE NOSE OF THE MOUSE INSIDE IS RED. THE FLIPPERS OF THE SEA LION ARE GREY. ARIA AMOROSE HAS NEVER BEEN DISPLAYED AND IS IN PRISTINE CONDITION, . SHIPPING, HANDLING AND INSURANCE, $7.00. ALL MY AUCTIONS YIELD NOTHING BUT THE BEST! GOOD LUCK!! This listing created by eBay Seller's Assistant Basic. Free Honesty Counters powered by Andale! Visit Suncookie today! I built up a 550+ feedback rating while working with Socko! Comics. Now I am starting over on my own, but that means starting with a feedback of zero. Read my Honesty Policy below. NM 1970 ASTONISHING TALES 1 - 8 : KAZAR & DR DOOM QUESTIONS: click here to send an e-mail CONDITION : NEAR MINT OPENING BID: $9.99 HOW TO PAY? MONEY ORDER & PAYPAL HOW TO SHIP? I ship via United States Postal Service for both domestic and international. You pay only the cost required to ship. I do not believe in padding auctions by adding unjustified extra charges. I don't like it when people do it to me, so I won't do it to you. PICTURES: Click on each to get a larger view. _ #1 #7 HONESTY POLICY I have met people in my store who won books on E-Bay that were nowhere near the condition described. It angers me as a seller because it ruins the reputations of dealers as a whole. Simply put, it hurts our market by driving away customers. How Do I Grade? I look at every book and grade it according to six categories: front cover, back cover, corners, edges, spine & staples, interior pages. I give a complete description of each of these sections noting any flaws or defects. Also, I include large scans of the front and back covers. When I have completed the auction page, I am satisfied that you know exactly what you are bidding on and that there will be no surprises at auction's end. So what about returns? At first I offered returns on books. Then I quickly discovered that some people would outbid everyone else by an excessively high amount just to get a look at the book, then ask for a return if they decided they didn't want it. I no longer offer returns. I am confident in my grading and description and have never had a complaint about either. If you are not sure that you want the book then don't bid on it. COMPLETE DESCRIPTION: _ All books have come from the same collection and have received the same care over the years. Title: Astonishing Tales Featuring Kazar and Dr. Doom Issue(s) & Date(s): #1, August 1970 - #8, October 1971 Double feature books. Issues feature work by Kirby, Wood and Barry Smith. Appearances by Black Panther, Kraven, Nixon & Red Skull. This run represents the first Mavel Villain solo series. Front Cover: Strong gloss, bright color, clean white. No tears, creases or fading. Back Cover: Strong gloss, bright color, white. No tears, creases or fading. Corners: Sharp with minimal to no wear. Minor crease wear at lower right corner of issue #4. Wear at upper and lower left corners of issue #8. Edges: Sharp, clear definition. Spine & Staples: Strong, straight and clean. A few crease lines near bottom staple of issue #4. Minor wear along spine edge of issue #8. Interior Pages: White. Strong, bright color. The books come bagged and boarded. Check out our other auctions for more great books! MORE QUESTIONS? Items.Name: Kriss Kross Safety Razor Blade Stropper RARE
Items.Description: This rare safety blade strop comes with the original box marked "Rhodes Kriss Kross Safety Blade Stropper. Price six dollars. Sold by Rhodes Mfg. Co., St. Louis". The box is in good shape. Still strong with no split corners. The strop itself is a remarkedly well designed machine. There is a sliding lock handle on the blade holder and a fold over cranking handle. The blade holder flips over as the handle is cranked to strop both sides of the blade. The body of the machine is marked on top and bottom similar to the printing on the box. Patent numbers are on the bottom dating from June 1921 to January 1927. Although used, it will clean up nicely. Shipping/handling is $3.90. I accept money orders, Billpoint or PayPal. Will ship within one day of receipt of payment. Free Honesty Counters powered by Andale! Items.Name: Vintage Wild Bill Elliot Comic Book 1955
Items.Description: Vintage Wild Bill Elliot Comic Book 1955 This Rare "Wild Bill Elliot" comic book No.643 was published quarterly by Dell Publishing Co. The copyright is 1955 by Stephen Slesinger. It has 34 pages with two stories and many color illustrations. A partial listing of the contents follows: On the cover are "Famous Knots You Can Tie" like a "Square Knot" -- "Lariat Loop" -- "Sheepshank" -- "Bowline" Inside the front cover is an article with an illustration showing the "Distinguished Achievement Award presented to Mr. George T. Delacorte, Jr. by Newsdealers Post Number 1169 American Legion on November 14, 1954. Wild Bill Elliot in: "Mystery of Furnace Valley" -- 17 pages Wild Bill Elliot in: "Peril at Sundown" -- 17 pages This vintage Wild Bill Elliot comic book is in good condition. There are some tiny light brown spots on the covers. Other than that, there are No rips or tears. The binding is tight and the pages are white. These collector's comics are getting harder to find, as many were lost or badly damaged over the years. This vintage Wild Bill Elliot comic will be a nice addition to your western comic collection. Items.Name: HULK 111-200 (29 issues) VF/NM Very Nice!!
Items.Description: You're bidding on a VERY NICE run of ol' Greenskin. Included are issues: 111,112,116,123,124,126,127,128,129,130,131,133,134,136,137,140,141,142,143,145,146,148,149,151,152,153,155, and #200.. Plus Incredible Hulk Special #4. All are in BEAUTIFUL condition.. really nice comics. The only exception to this would be Issue # 200 which has some dark scuffing amidst the white background. Amazing the newest one is the worst.. and even it's prob at least a Fine grade comic. I believe issue 141 is the first appearance of Doc Samson.. saw it on here for about $50 all by itself and prob not as good as this one.. It looks about perfect to me. Issues 123,124,129,130, and 131 have store date stamps on the light part of the covers.. but nothing major.. other than that they appear to be NM. It would take me forever to look at each and every page of this many comics but the few I opened and checked only showed to be a little off-white around the edges.. and near the center. Nothing out of the ordinary for a 30 year old comic. Saw no creases or any other obvious blemishes.. other than those with the store dates. All are bagged and boarded.. and rather than risk damaging them in scans I chose to scan them in the covers so if you see a little "shimmer" .. it's the scan... not the comic. I really don't think you'll be dissapointed in any way with the condition of these comics. If so just tell me within 3 days and I'll refund your money.. minus shipping. I think that's a fair proposition. Trying to describe these as best I can so you'll know what you're getting before you bid. I haven't researched anything as to their true value.. I'll leave it to some savy bidders to do the research and bid accordingly. I'll start the bidding at $60 which I believe is a steal for this quality and quantity. I hate to set any limits at all but I feel 2 dollars a book is a pretty good buy.Sentimentally they're worth a lot more to me.. a part of my youth I held on to for all these years. You probably can't get that many brand new comics at that price. Much less true collector items. Anyways.. that's the deal. Hope you like what you see. Will accept PayPal, Money Orders, and Cashiers Check. Shipping will be a flat 7 dollars which will include: Well packed USPS Priority Shipping, Tracking # and insurance covering the total bid price. May cost more to do all this.. will be a fairly heavy package but I lean towards the buyer when it comes to shipping charges. I'm a buyer myself :) Thanks for looking and HAVE A VERY MERRY CHRISTMAS!! Items.Name: Oriental Batik:Wall Hanging-Dragon ,Phoenix 3
Items.Description: China has a long history of batik production dating back to the sixth century. Today you can still find batik being done by the ethnic people in Guizhou Province, in the South-West of China. Here the Miao, Bouyei and Gejia people use a dye resist method that is different from the Han Chinese. The Miao place great emphasis on their costumes which are made up of decorative fabrics which they achieve by pattern weaving and wax resist. Almost all the Miao decorate hemp and cotton (not silk) by applying hot wax then dipping the cloth in an indigo dye. The cloth is then used for skirts, panels on jackets, aprons and baby carriers. Indigo is used chiefly for the basic cloth throughout Guizo to give dark blues. A paste is made from the harvested plants which have been soaked in a wooden barrel. Wax resisted fabric was probably one of the earliest forms of decoration in Guizhou as all the materials were at hand. Beeswax is the main ingredient but other resins or wax are possibly added. The wax resist never exploits crackle, the aim is to produce a clear image and beeswax is both tenacious and flexible. The wax is often heated in a little pot, resting in hot embers. Once applied the wax appears black on the fabric but at the end of the process the wax is removed from the fabric. The fabric is then rinsed in cool water and air dried. The beeswax can be reused. The usual tools for applying wax are of copper and brass with bamboo handles. They are made from 2 small triangular pieces of metal, their apexes bound to a bamboo holder by copper wire. It is held like a pen either upright or at a slant to the cloth which is laid flat on a board. This tool lends itself to the drawing of straight or slightly curving lines. The Miao, Gejia and Bouyei girls are highly skilled at batik. They use very finely drawn circular and double spiral designs representing the horns of the water buffalo, symbolising their ancestor's life and death. Girls start learning to produce batik from the age of 6 and 7 years. The finest work is found on baby carriers, sleeves of their jackets and skirts. The more traditional designs are geometric, where the most skilled wax resist reads as a fine blue line on a white ground. With the influence of the Han Chinese more figurative designs like flowers, birds, fish have been introduced over the centuries. This item is Dragon & Phoenix (3) batik.Size:45 inches long and 45 inches wide.International shipping postage is 9 US $.Combine shipping postage can be reduced.BATIK CAN ONLY BE SENT ON SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. Items.Description: 1963 Bing & Grondahl Christmas Plate In Mint Condition! The Christmas Plate or "Juleplatte" stems from an ancient Danish Tradition, transformed into fine porcelain by Harald Bing in 1895. Originally, the Christmas Plates were a gesture of thanks presented by Danish Nobility to their servants at Christmas time. It was the thought of immortalizing this "gesture of thanks" in fine porcelain that has given the world a beautiful symbol of Christmas Spirit as well as the wonderful hobby of plate collecting, enjoyed by millions today. The Motif of this plates is "The Christmas Elf ". Designed by Henry Thelander. Size: 7" -_ 18 cm. Very Rare. No Reserve. Mint Condition. Items.Name: WINTERHALTER HOFMEIER BRACKET CLOCK-1/4 hr.

Bidder.Location: CHECK OUT MY OTHER AUCTIONS FOR QUALITY ITEMS

Items.Description: This is a high quality 1/4 hour chime bracket clock. This is a Lancet style or English Gothic Bracket clock. It is in excellent running order. The heavy movement has thick plates. The BIMBAM movement, chimes once on the quarter, twice on the 1/2 hour and 3 times on the 3/4 hour on two large gongs. It strikes the hour on one gong. It has a beautiful resounding tone. The silver dial has WHEATLEY above the center hole and CARLISLE under the center hole. The bezel has heavy beveled glass. The dial has a fast/slow adjustment at the top of the dial. This beautiful clock has string inlay edging the clock with accents in front and sides. The handles on the sides are especially pretty. The feet are typical bracket style feet. The pendulum is very heavy. It also comes with a old key. The markings on the movement(just in case my picture doesn't come thru) is W & H and under that is SCH and under that is stamped 2. Please look at our pictures and email any questions. Our reserve is $550. for this excellent clock. Shipping in the U.S. is $40.00. Thanks for looking! God Bless America!

Items.Name: Portsmouth NH Electric Trolley Booklet 1966
Items.Description: This original, complete booklet titled - PORTSMOUTH ELECTRIC RAILWAY, by O.R. Cummings and published in 1966. It is complete and in very good condition. It seems that a company named Electric Traction Quarterly published various editions relating to trolley cars. This is an edition concerning Portsmouth, New Hampshire and its surrounding area, e.g., Hampton Beach &c. Replete with photographs and a detail and interesting history of this earlier form of prevalent transportation. It also includes a map illustration of their routes and well as illustrations of their schedules, tickets and revenue information. The scan(s) for this item may have been increased for better detail or reduced to facilitate faster viewing. Shipping is $1.75. Insurance is your option. Your item(s) are mailed 1st. Class (unless Priority Mail stipulated) _ Your personal check will not delay your shipment. For your convenience I use the PAYPAL INSTANT PURCHASE credit card payment method should you chose this mode of remittance. There is a link for this type of transaction on each auction page. This is another item from my lifetime collection of rare postcards as well as other important historical ephemera as well as old rare books. I am selling this collection, in its entirety, exclusively on eBay,. To be fair, I do not sell privately. Every item was personally acquired over several decades by inheritance, estate purchases, institutions, private negotiation from other collections and from museum de-accessioning. This entire collection is stored within a safe, smoke free, climate controlled, clean facility. Nothing offered is easily found. The name of this collection is _ RARE FARE. Since I am regularly listing items, I hope that you will bookmark my SELLER PAGES by my USER NAME rarefare. Thank you for looking and please feel free to access the ASK SELLER A QUESTION link if you have any comments, suggestions or just desire additional information.

Recommend this seller.Dec 3 2001)).All grades are guarenteed within 0.5 of any grading service. The grade quoted above is an accurate grade reflecting the true condition of the book.(Any defect not revealed by the large scan will be discussed apart).The price is set so that you will be hard pressed to find as good a deal anywhere else.(This 33% bigger scan( than the books' actual size) magnifies and enlarges defects-it is like looking at the book through a magnification factor). Generally speaking the book possess's a solid intact spine with no splits;staples solidly in place;corners sharp;gloss and color deapth vivid,deep and close to new in appearance;only minor spine stress marks may exist(similar to thoses produced at original printing);overall a glossy off white to WHITE paged copy offered at an unbeatable initial bid ,with a LOW RESERVE(This low reserve allows our customers to use the buy it now feature.Many have missed out on previous books,and this feature usually prolongs the auction a bit longer to give everyone a chance to bid).As we have a large multiple grade inventory of Silver and Golden age books,many will be offered for sale in coming ads.There are many comics being auctioned off on Ebay this week.Combine auctions to save postage.THOUSANDS of other books are still to come including most Marvel and DC titles from 1960 -1972.Use the BUY IT NOW feature to end the auction and lock out the competition. Here are the reasons; 1)All defects are CLEARLY seen.(in our opinion a small scan is of no use-the grade can be anything). 2) By revealing all defects,you can grade based upon what you like or dislike about a book. 3) No two grades have the same defects,thus a large scan allows you to delineate the key aspects of the book. 4)A large scan will OVERSTATE defects.Defects appear LARGER than what you will see when you get the book.(This applies especially to creases(thicker than actual),and stress marks,and to a lesser extent to color tones,which may show gradations in color not visible with the naked eye).Most of our customers note that the book is nicer when it arrives than what this scan revealed(reasons;the scans bright flood light reveal evey single microscopic impact point,plus defects appear 33% larger.) 5)All our books are guaranteed to be in the same general grade range(within+/- 0.5) if the book is slabbed(within 14 days of purchase) 6) Full exchange privledges on any item purchased.within 7 days. 7) Shipping : Cost; 5.00 for less than 5 comics(priority mail with delivery confirmation) in North America NOTE ;Allow 2 weeks for material to reach you;we often beat that,but increased security screening by the post office can delay shipping time;we take full responsibility.... ..Questions and/or comments?
